newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Skanska says merges Myresjo unit, RorviksGruppen.
newsitem.headline: Skanska says merges Myresjo unit, RorviksGruppen.

text.p: Swedish construction and real estate group Skanska AB said on Wednesday it had signed an agreement in principle to merge its Myresjo Tra saw mill operations with forestry group RorviksGruppen.
The merger is conditional on RorviksGruppen being split into an engineering unit and a sawmill operation and that both units are listed on the stock exchange, Skanska said in a statement.

"After the split of operations, the intention is that Myresjo Tra AB will merge with the sawmill operations through a non-cash issue whereby Myresjo AB will hold a 40 percent interest in the new sawmill group," the company said.
The new sawmill group will have an annual production capacity of nearly 500,000 cubic metres at eight sawmills and sales of about one billion crowns, Skanska said.
The Myresjo group's forest holdings, with Boxholm Skogar and subsidiaries, are not affected by the merger, Skanska said.
